trans-unit.source: When you no longer need a data disk that's attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.
trans-unit.target: When you no longer need a data disk that's attached to a virtual machine, you can easily detach it.

trans-unit.source: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.
trans-unit.target: This removes the disk from the virtual machine, but doesn't remove it from storage.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use the existing data on the disk again, you can reattach it to the same virtual machine, or another one.

trans-unit.source: A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks -- an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.
trans-unit.target: A virtual machine in Azure uses different types of disks -- an operating system disk, a local temporary disk, and optional data disks.

trans-unit.source: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Data disks are the recommended way to store data for a virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <linkText>About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <linkText>About Disks and VHDs for Virtual Machines</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It's not possible to detach an operating system disk unless you also delete the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: It's not possible to detach an operating system disk unless you also delete the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Before you can detach a disk from a virtual machine, you need to find out the LUN number, which is an identifier for the disk to be detached.
trans-unit.target: Before you can detach a disk from a virtual machine, you need to find out the LUN number, which is an identifier for the disk to be detached.

trans-unit.source: To do that, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To do that, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Open Azure CLI for Mac, Linux, and Windows and connect to your Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Connect to Azure from Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> for more details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Connect to Azure from Azure CLI</linkText><title></title> for more details.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default by typing azure config mode asm.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you are in Azure Service Management mode, which is the default by typing azure config mode asm.

trans-unit.source: Find out which disks are attached to your virtual machine by using azure vm disk list as follows:
trans-unit.target: Find out which disks are attached to your virtual machine by using azure vm disk list as follows:

trans-unit.source: Note the LUN or the logical unit number for the disk that you want to detach.
trans-unit.target: Note the LUN or the logical unit number for the disk that you want to detach.

trans-unit.source: After you find the LUN number of the disk, you're ready to detach it:
trans-unit.target: After you find the LUN number of the disk, you're ready to detach it:

trans-unit.source: Detach the selected disk from the virtual machine by running the command azure vm disk detach like this:
trans-unit.target: Detach the selected disk from the virtual machine by running the command azure vm disk detach like this:

trans-unit.source: You can check if the disk got detached by running this command:
trans-unit.target: You can check if the disk got detached by running this command:

trans-unit.source: The detached disk remains in storage but is no longer attached to a virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The detached disk remains in storage but is no longer attached to a virtual machine.
